title: MRC Launches Innovative, New and Improved Website
text:
MRC Launches Innovative, New and Improved Website September 10, 2015 17:50 ET | Source: Merchant Risk Council 
SEATTLE, Sept. 10, 2015 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Today the Merchant Risk Council (MRC) launched their innovative and highly interactive new website in conjunction with an updated logo and several comprehensive new resources including a Cost of Fraud Calculator and MRC Communities (coming soon). Not only does MRC's redesigned website have a new look and feel, but navigation is much more user friendly, and access is readily available from any device and browser. The goal behind the new website is to provide members with a transformative new platform to share information, utilize education and network with other like-minded industry peers. Other new features of the website include: improved functionality, advanced search engine optimization and customizable member profiles. The MRC also released their Cost of Fraud Calculator in partnership with Riskified , a venture-backed fraud prevention solution provider for eCommerce merchants. This tool will present a holistic picture of an organization's true cost of fraud and visualize the business and financial impact in which risk and fraud professionals can share with executives. Furthermore, the new and improved website will also host MRC Communities, an interactive forum members can use to discuss the latest industry trends, ask questions and share ideas. MRC Communities are segmented by the following categories: payments, fraud, law enforcement and gamer safety alliance. Members will have the opportunity to converse about current or future issues, industry trends, best practices, industry data, vendor solution support to merchants and merchant feedback to vendors about solution needs. MRC Communities will be available to members in the coming weeks. In addition to the roll out of their new website, the MRC also released an updated logo to better represent the direction of their organization. The refreshed logo provides a more modern visual dynamic to the brand and the MRC's identity. "As the MRC looks to the future, a continued goal of ours is to provide members with the most relevant education, innovative resources and rewarding networking opportunities. Therefore, we're excited to continue building upon this productivity to make significant transformations and additions to our organization," says Danielle Nagao, CEO. View the new website, resources and logo here. About the MRC: The MRC is an unbiased global community providing a platform for eCommerce fraud and payments professionals to come together and share information. As a not-for-profit entity, the MRC's vision is to make commerce safe and profitable everywhere by offering proprietary education, training and networking as well as a forum for timely and relevant discussions. The MRC was launched in 2000 at the start of the eCommerce boom by a small group of industry professionals from leading consumer brands, with the ultimate goal of combating online fraud in the card not present space. Since its inception, the MRC has also added online payments to its portfolio, expanding its presence further into eCommerce. The MRC is headquartered in Seattle, WA and has an office in Madrid, Spain. MEDIA CONTACT: Emma Cloninger, Marketing Associate TELEPHONE: 206-364-2789 x152 EMAIL: Related Articles
